review: Had this 3 weeks and couldn't get it to work with my wireless router, even though chromecast documentation said it was compatible.  Looked online for solutions, most of which were very technical and beyond my comfort level.  Router manufacturer wouldn't provide support since the warranty had expired.  Ended up returning it.  So, lesson learned, some things aren't as easy as plug in and go.

author: TEConnor

review: Pros:- Great resolution/clarity- Lets you watch your phone/computer on your TV. This includes TV shows you might have missed, twitch.tv, etc- Smart in a number of ways. For instance, when you start casting it will turn on your TV and switch it to the Chromecast inputCons:- If the wifi connection drops for even a moment, you need to run back to your computer to start casting. No automatic reconnect- Cannot adjust the screen area via chromecast. It is cutting off the edges on two of my TVs (about 15% each way). This causes some streams to lose vital information- Support is via google forums. Answers tend to be basic. No clear way to provide feedback for beta products (the Chrome extension)
